Package org.openstreetmap.josm.plugins.makeparallel.actions

Class MakeParallelAction

java.lang.Object
javax.swing.AbstractAction
org.openstreetmap.josm.actions.JosmAction
org.openstreetmap.josm.plugins.makeparallel.actions.MakeParallelAction
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.util.EventListener, javax.swing.Action, Destroyable
public class MakeParallelAction
extends JosmAction
MakeParallel Make segments of a way Parallel to each other.
See Also:

      public boolean isClosedPath​(java.util.List<Node> nodelist)
      Returns true if the list of nodes form a closed path.
      Parameters:
      nodelist - The list of nodes
      Returns:
      True if closed path

    • isSpecialNode

      public boolean isSpecialNode​(Node node)
      Checks if a node is special and should not be deleted. That is if a node has tags on it or is part of multiple ways
      Parameters:
      node - The node
      Returns:
      True if special

    • actionPerformed

      public void actionPerformed​(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
      Called when the action is executed, typically with keyboard shortcut. This method looks at what is selected and performs the action

    • SanityCheck

      private boolean SanityCheck​(java.util.List<Node> selection)
      Checks if the input is as expected.
      Parameters:
      selection - The selected nodes.
      Returns:
      True if input is as expected, false otherwise.

    • getSegmentFromWay

      private java.util.List<Node> getSegmentFromWay​(Node n1, Node n2)
      Traverses the way that node n1 belongs to until it reaches n2 and returns the segment. Both nodes should be on the same way. The nodes should have single parent way.
      Parameters:
      n1 - the node on the way to mark the start of the segment
      n2 - the node on the way to mark the end of the segment
      Returns:
      The list of nodes that make the segment

    • calculateDistance

      private double calculateDistance​(java.util.List<Node> s1, java.util.List<Node> s2)
      Calculates the the distance for makeSegmentsParallel
      Parameters:
      s1 - The source segment to make parallel
      s2 - The destination segment to make parallel
      Returns:
      The distance in the correct direction (hopefully)

    • addOrRemoveNodesToMatchSegments

      private boolean addOrRemoveNodesToMatchSegments​(java.util.List<Node> s1, java.util.List<Node> s2)
      Adds or Removes nodes from the destination segment s2 to match the number of nodes in source s1.
      Parameters:
      s1 - The source segment
      s2 - The destination segment
      Returns:
      true if successful

    • makeSegmentsParallel

      private void makeSegmentsParallel​(java.util.List<Node> s1, java.util.List<Node> s2, double d)
      Move the nodes from segment s2 to be parallel to s1 at distance d. This is the main function that makes the segments Paralell
      Parameters:
      s1 - containing nodes from source segment
      s2 - containing nodes from destination segment
      d - the distance
